column4: any idea why he install works on my laptop but not on my workstation?
what it is trying to install, exactly?
does it want to install alot of packages, or just one?
it downloads everyting and stops at 'Preconfiguring packages...'.
but it downloaded ONE package or MANY?
do you use synaptic for install?

so, as it is failing somewhere, try to install packages it wanted to install one-by one, and find which one fails.  Somewhat.. boring stuff but at least you will know where the problem is, and can debug from that point.
it should print a list of all pkgs it wants to install. so try some libs first, when some other things etc...
since it is failing somewhere, and xserver is a "part" of ubuntu-desktop, it may fail too. or may not fail, as we don't yet know why it is failing...
there are several ways to debug the prob, but they're quite.. complicated
re "compiling from scratch": it's some packaging scripts (provided by ubuntu) which fails
there's none because hoary isn't released yet
